cards.name: Braixen
cards.text: When the twig is plucked from its tail, friction sets the twig alight. The flame is used to send signals to its allies.

attacks.name: Flare Parade
attacks.text: This attack does 60 damage for each Serena card in your discard pile.

cards.name: Milotic
cards.text: Milotic has provided inspiration to many artists. It has even been referred to as the most beautiful Pokémon of all.

attacks.name: Water Arrow
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Mellow Wave
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Flaaffy

abilities.name: Dynamotor
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Lightning Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.text: It stores electricity in its fluffy fleece. If it stores up too much, it will start to go bald in those patches.

cards.name: Jynx

abilities.name: Selfish Lips
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from an attack from your opponent's Pokémon V, your opponent can't take any Prize cards for it.

cards.text: In certain parts of Galar, Jynx was once feared and worshiped as the Queen of Ice.

attacks.name: Psychic Assault
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Gardevoir

abilities.name: Refinement
abilities.text: You must discard a card from your hand in order to use this Ability. Once during your turn, you may draw 2 cards.

cards.text: It has the power to predict the future. Its power peaks when it is protecting its Trainer.

cards.name: Malamar
cards.text: It's said that Malamar's hypnotic powers played a role in certain history-changing events.

attacks.name: Rapid Strike Tentacles
attacks.text: Reveal any number of Rapid Strike cards from your hand. This attack does 40 damage for each card you revealed in this way. Then, shuffle those cards into your deck.

cards.name: Rockruff
cards.text: When it rubs the rocks on its neck against you, that's proof of its love for you. However, the rocks are sharp, so the gesture is quite painful!

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Passimian

abilities.name: Throwing Coach
abilities.text: Your Rapid Strike Pokémon's attacks do 30 more damage to your opponent's Benched Pokémon V and Benched Pokémon-GX (before applying Weakness and Resistance). You can't apply more than 1 Throwing Coach Ability at a time.

cards.text: Passimian live in groups of about 20, with each member performing an assigned role. Through cooperation, the group survives.

attacks.name: Fling
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Druddigon
cards.text: Druddigon are vicious and cunning. They take up residence in nests dug out by other Pokémon, treating the stolen nests as their own lairs.

attacks.name: Revenge
attacks.text: If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an attack from your opponent's Pokémon during their last turn, this attack does 120 more damage.

cards.name: Smeargle
cards.text: It draws symbols with the fluid that oozes from the tip of its tail. Depending on the symbol, Smeargle fanatics will pay big money for them.

attacks.name: Colorful Palette
attacks.text: Look at the top 5 cards of your deck. You may attach any number of basic Energy cards you find there to 1 of your Pokémon. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

cards.name: Altaria
cards.text: As it flies in a calm and relaxed manner, Altaria performs a humming song that would enrapture any audience.

attacks.name: Magical Echo
attacks.text: Move all damage counters from 1 of your Benched Pokémon to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Kricketune V

abilities.name: Exciting Stage
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may draw cards until you have 3 cards in your hand. If this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, you may draw cards until you have 4 cards in your hand instead. You can't use more than 1 Exciting Stage Ability each turn.

cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: X-Scissor
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 80 more damage.

cards.name: Serperior V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Noble Light
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from each Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's).

cards.name: Blaziken V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Fire Spin
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Blaziken VMAX
cards.text: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Clutch
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

attacks.name: Max Blaze
attacks.text: Choose up to 2 of your Benched Rapid Strike Pokémon and attach an Energy card from your discard pile to each of them.

cards.name: Zeraora V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Cross Fist
attacks.text: If 1 of your other Rapid Strike Pokémon used an attack during your last turn, this attack also does 160 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Mawile V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Pouty Slap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Chomp Down
attacks.text: Discard a random card from your opponent's hand.

cards.name: Corviknight V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Clutch
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

attacks.name: Sky Hurricane
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use Sky Hurricane.

cards.name: Corviknight VMAX

abilities.name: Lustrous Body
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of your opponent's Pokémon's Abilities done to this Pokémon.

cards.text: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: G-Max Hurricane
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use G-Max Hurricane.

cards.name: Rayquaza VMAX

abilities.name: Azure Pulse
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may discard your hand and draw 3 cards.

cards.text: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Max Burst
attacks.text: You may discard any amount of basic Fire Energy or any amount of basic Lightning Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 80 more damage for each card you discarded in this way.

cards.name: Duraludon VMAX

abilities.name: Skyscraper
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon that have Special Energy attached.

cards.text: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: G-Max Pulverization
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Blissey V

abilities.name: Natural Cure
abilities.text: Whenever you attach an Energy card from your hand to this Pokémon, remove all Special Conditions from it.

cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Blissful Blast
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Energy attached to this Pokémon. If you did any damage with this attack, you may attach up to 3 Energy cards from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Friends in Galar
cards.text: Draw 3 cards.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Gordie
cards.text: Look at the top 7 cards of your deck. You may reveal any number of Energy cards you find there and put them into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Judge
cards.text: Each player shuffles their hand into their deck and draws 4 cards.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Professor Burnet
cards.text: Search your deck for up to 2 cards and discard them. Then, shuffle your deck.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Raihan
cards.text: You can play this card only if any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out during your opponent's last turn. Attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Pokémon. If you do, search your deck for a card and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Sordward & Shielbert
cards.text: Choose a Trainer card from your discard pile. Then, ask your opponent if you may put it into your hand. If yes, put that card into your hand. If no, draw 3 cards.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Rayquaza VMAX

abilities.name: Azure Pulse
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may discard your hand and draw 3 cards.

cards.text: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Max Burst
attacks.text: You may discard any amount of basic Fire Energy or any amount of basic Lightning Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 80 more damage for each card you discarded in this way.

cards.name: Duraludon VMAX

abilities.name: Skyscraper
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon that have Special Energy attached.

cards.text: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: G-Max Pulverization
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.
